metadata.synopsis: Karlach's inparty dialogue when she's in your party and you click on herOrder of nodes:1. Generic Blockers (Jaheira/Other avatar/Mindflayer)2. IPRDs (will override anything under it)3. Astarion's bite4. InRegion/specific situations branches5. Romance branches.6. Default greeting node.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Use companion debug to recruit Karlach + click on her

16.speaker: Karlach
16.text: It's not that I want to collect them, per se. It's just that if we should happen upon them, I can use them in battle to fire up my engine.

13.speaker: Karlach
13.text: Evil's evil, but it can be put to good use. Sometimes. Maybe. Right?

22.speaker: Karlach
22.text: We were both part of Zariel's inner circle. Her by choice. Me by force.

80.speaker: Karlach
80.text: In the grand scheme of things, I'm inconsequential to Zariel. Sure, I've got the engine. But I wasn't even her strongest fighter.

70.speaker: Karlach
70.text: But she favoured me like a child favours a captive pet. Mizora envied the attention, I suppose.

76.speaker: Karlach
76.text: I'm sure when Zariel gave her the order to hunt me down, Mizora was delighted.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: She's given me no further instructions to harm you, at least.

44.speaker: Karlach
44.text: I guess that's good news, right? Maybe Zariel's found some other poor sap to occupy her interest.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Do you think she'll keep coming after you?

88.speaker: Karlach
88.text: I don't know. You'd think she'd have more important things to do. Devils and their pride.
88.context: NodeContext: in response to 'Do you think Mizora will keep ocming after you?'

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I can see why you were so keen to escape.

56.speaker: Karlach
56.text: No kidding. The fighting, the chaos, the betrayal... it had the makings of a good stage show, but I did not want to be one of the players.

26.speaker: Karlach
26.text: We didn't lose him. We sent him away. To the Hells, to serve Zariel as a fucking lemure.

18.speaker: Karlach
18.text: I keep going over what I'd have done diffferently, if I had the chance. We could've just done exactly what Mizora said. Bought ourselves a little time to get Wyll free.

8.speaker: Karlach
8.text: I was so certain I didn't want to do anything that'd help Zariel. But I was wrong.

67.speaker: Karlach
67.text: We failed him. I failed him. I just can't forgive myself for that.

33.speaker: Karlach
33.text: Funny you should ask. I was just thinking about what would've become of us without that nautiloid.

48.speaker: Karlach
48.text: I mean, I know where I'd be. Trapped in Avernus still, with the Blade of Frontiers on my tail. But what about you?

97.speaker: Player
97.text: I would have been continuing my mission for Lady Shar.

24.speaker: Karlach
24.text: Good old Lady Shar. Fair enough. I probably would've been stuck serving an evil mistress too, if I'm honest.

30.speaker: Karlach
30.text: I know we're different, but I'm glad that mad ship brought us together. Who knows where we'll end up?

63.speaker: Player
63.text: I would have been heading for Baldur's Gate. I have matters to tend to there.

40.speaker: Karlach
40.text: I wonder if we ever crossed paths in the Gate. We would've been a lot younger, but I feel like yours is a face I wouldn't easily forget.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Chasing a terrible devil called Karlach across Avernus - you might have heard of her.

28.speaker: Karlach
28.text: Wonder if you would've caught me. Would we have figured it all out, come to terms, or would it have been a case of last lunkhead standing?

85.speaker: Karlach
85.text: Happy the nautiloid intervened before we snapped each others' necks.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Raging against ghaik in my Rite of Ascension.

41.speaker: Karlach
41.text: Now there's a sight I'd like to see. The great Lae'zel climbing a mind flayer like a scorpion, taking it down with one fatal strike.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Prowling Baldur's Gate at night, finding victims I can lure back to Cazador.

61.speaker: Karlach
61.text: It's hard to picture, honestly. That Cazador could never beat you in a fair fight.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Oh, who can say? Maybe lounging in some tavern.

81.speaker: Karlach
81.text: I'd like to have joined you there. Roaring fire, frosty drink, a bard in the corner...

58.speaker: Karlach
58.text: You probably would've told me to kick rocks, but I'd have a good time.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: I've a... condition I need to manage. I'd still be looking for a cure.

2.speaker: Karlach
2.text: We have more in common than I knew. I won't pry for details. Right now, at least.
2.context: NodeContext: Karlach wants the goss but won't pry

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Wandering the wilds of Faerûn searching for a cure to the orb. If I lived that long...

51.speaker: Karlach
51.text: Living a normal lifespan is so yesterday. Believe me.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: This is... all there has ever been. I remember only snippets of red.

37.speaker: Karlach
37.text: It'll come back to you. Maybe you'll recognise something we pass, or maybe we'll find out what happened to you.

64.speaker: Karlach
64.text: I get the feeling we've got a long road ahead of us. I hope we find you some answers along the way.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: I'd be back in my home, not a care in the world.

27.speaker: Karlach
27.text: Ah man, lucky you. That's the dream. Maybe when this is all done, you can show me where you came from.

47.speaker: Karlach
47.text: My family home's long gone, but I'll show you my favourite chowhall in the city, if it's still standing.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: I'd be in the middle of another adventure, blessedly free of any tadpole.

50.speaker: Karlach
50.text: I can picture you getting mixed up in some outrageous shit. Giants, beholders, Thayans, the works.

5.speaker: Karlach
5.text: Maybe once we've wrapped up the current shenanigans, we'll rest a bit and find some new heap of trouble to throw ourselves at.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: So much has happened, I can barely remember what life was like before the abduction.

72.speaker: Karlach
72.text: Lucky you. Sometimes I think I'd be better off indulging in a bit of light oblivion.

94.speaker: Karlach
94.text: Well. We may as well make some good memories mixed in with the body horror, eh?

36.speaker: Karlach
36.text: He got his claws into me early. I was a wild kid - brawling my way through the city.

95.speaker: Karlach
95.text: One of my mates got wind of a bit of work guarding some indoorsy type with lots of enemies. Seemed like easy money, so I went in for it.

83.speaker: Karlach
83.text: He took one look at me and said I was perfect. I liked that. Not like that, you know. Just - it felt like a good fit.
83.context: NodeContext: She's trying to explain that this relationship wasn't inappropriate/ sexual, but that they had good professional rapport

71.speaker: Karlach
71.text: I kept him safe, and he paid me well. Well enough to move into a better neighbourhood and put something away for the future. My future.

78.speaker: Karlach
78.text: I respected him. Trusted him. And he returned that trust, that respect. His life was in my hands, and I took that seriously.

52.speaker: Karlach
52.text: The whole thing with Zariel happened so fast. I had no idea what had gone down until it was over. One minute I was in Baldur's Gate, a happy, healthy not-quite-kid. The next, I was burning up in Avernus with an engine for a heart.

31.speaker: Karlach
31.text: Zariel laughed. Said she paid him well for my services. She'd wanted to test her new machine, and he said I'd be able to handle it.

29.speaker: Karlach
29.text: He was right. Sometimes I wished he weren't. Evil, evil bastard.

42.speaker: Karlach
42.text: You saw the extent of Flo's friendship. She'll lend you a hand, long as she can crush your spirit while she's at it.

54.speaker: Karlach
54.text: I knew never to let my guard down around her. But she always made me laugh, even when I least wanted to.

11.speaker: Karlach
11.text: If she'd been completely different from who she was, we might've been real friends.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: She gave you a note. What did it say?

1.speaker: Karlach
1.text: Nothing worth reading. Cambion manipulation at its most obvious.
1.context: NodeContext: She's glossing over this a little. The letter says 'I miss you'. Whether this is cambion manipulation or not, it affects Karlach in a way she's not willing to admit.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Unfortunately, a leopard can't change its spots.

4.speaker: Karlach
4.text: And a devil will never not break your heart.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Pity. Sounds like she meant something to you, in whatever small way.

74.speaker: Karlach
74.text: I guess she did. Much as it makes me want to puke to admit it.

25.speaker: Karlach
25.text: Devils, you know? Fucking devils. They really screw with you, don't they?

15.speaker: Player
15.text: You do have real friends now. Me, for one.

92.speaker: Karlach
92.context: NodeContext: Player remakrs on their freindship with Karlach, but has low approval rating so Karlach is a bit glib.

59.speaker: Karlach
59.text: Thank the gods. And I do, every day.
59.context: NodeContext: Remarking that she's glad she has a real friend in the player

57.speaker: Karlach
57.text: Mizora. She lives off crumbs from Zariel's table. I've always hated the lick-arse. Obviously, the feeling is mutual.

66.speaker: Karlach
66.text: Thank the gods it's over, I say. My last trip to the Hells ever, ever.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Wasn't any part of you tempted to stay? Hope will probably turn that place into a real home.

46.speaker: Karlach
46.text: No such thing as a home in the Hells. If Hope's happy, good for her. But mark my words, some devil or other will push in and claim the place sooner or later.

23.speaker: Karlach
23.text: Stick around in Avernus long enough, and you'll run out of hope entirely.

69.speaker: Karlach
69.text: No, soldier, I'd rather live out my days in the world I love than live forever in a world I hate.

0.speaker: Karlach
0.text: I don't know much, but I do know that.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I knew we'd make it out in one piece.

68.speaker: Karlach
68.text: Right you are. Got what we came for, and then some.

6.speaker: Karlach
6.text: NEVER EVER. I mean it. That was my last hurrah in that hole for good.

7.speaker: Karlach
7.text: Engine's running like a bat out of Avernus again, though. Gods, I almost forgot how hot this thing is.

3.speaker: Karlach
3.text: Don't worry about me. I'll be fine. Probably.
3.context: NodeContext: Bit wry. She won't be fine.

73.speaker: Karlach
73.text: I don't know what I was expecting. Something beyond-real.

19.speaker: Karlach
19.text: My life would've been so different if I ended up working for her instead of Gortash. Looking after these kids. Making a difference.
19.context: NodeContext: A little sad, a little warm. Wistful.

55.speaker: Karlach
55.context: NodeContext: A little sad, a little warm. Wistful.

79.speaker: Karlach
79.text: Wasn't all that long ago. I never knew the whole of how and why, but I remember the devils slavering with delight.

17.speaker: Karlach
17.text: I should've looked after the Elturans more - gone out of my way to make sure they were all right.

45.speaker: Karlach
45.text: The long and short of it was I didn't want to risk my neck. I let them get on with the nightmare, same as I had to.

62.speaker: Karlach
62.text: But Avernus is no place for decent folk. I'm glad they got out. So glad.

87.speaker: Karlach
87.text: You saw the extent of Florenta the Garroter's friendship. She'll lend you a hand, long as she can crush your spirit while she's at it.

77.speaker: Karlach
77.text: A cambion, you won't be surprised to hear. I knew never to let my guard down around her. But the fucker made me laugh. Even - especially - when I least felt like it.

90.speaker: Karlach
90.text: Yeah! Let's go straight there. Whatever those fucks are getting up to, it's nothing good.

75.speaker: Karlach
75.text: Just to say, by the way, they're not really paladins. Lackeys of the archdevil playing dress-up as paladins of Tyr. No honour among devils.
